setup.question: Of the following situations, what was the toughest for Evelyn to handle?
answers: Having to dance for her boss

Text.text: Context: Earth is fighting with an alien race [the Scythians] and losing, and the protag,
has a mission to basically push a self-destruct button to try to take out the aliens too. At the beginning, the key to destroyed and she's also injured:

so she has no choice but to infiltrade the alien/enemy hideout and find the tools/materials to make another key. Also there's like mind control, basically everyone has like psychic powers. She uses these powers to get close to the enemy commander:
She gets close to the Commandant, Perat, who as a test of loyalty makes her shoot the prisoner, her dad!
Obviously it would be tougher both mentally and physically to kill her own dad, but she has to! Much more Ev if needed, just ran out of space this round.
provide the ev needed
Ev of when she realizes the prisoner is her father:
She then flashes back to her childhood memory:
Then she thinks about her options:

detonating the pile = completeing her mission of blowing up the Scytians.

 Ultmately she decides to kill her dad:
Her reaction:

expand more on this quote: "Our orders are to kill all prisoners"

So the father was mind controlled? why did she have to dance for her boss? the question is implying both are true but one is way worse. So i know there is evidence for B so pls provide
Context is the boss Scytian/Commandant Perat has just met Evelyn, and so he's explaining what he wants her to do and why:

The father isn't mind controlled, he's just a helpless prisoner. 

She has to dance for her boss to try to gain his trust/ to get him interested in her. To be able to dance for him, she basically has to prove her loyalty by killing her dad: After she shoots the dad, Perat tells her:
While she's dancing, Perat is probing her mind, but Evelyn even says that it's not hard to dance under those conditions:

mhmmmm two difficult situations. She does seem to handle the B's answer better than A's answer.Pls expand more on "She felt that she was going to be sick" this is what is winning it for you. So extend the quote
Sure! The context of that is she just shot her dad:
Then the Scytian commandant orders her to go to him.
Ev from right after 'she felt that she was going to be sick':
Perat/the commandant apologies:
and she only dances for him way later:
why did she decide to kill her dad?
She kills her dad to gain Perat/the enemy's trust so she could carry out her sucide mission:
He also tells her that if she kills the dad, she can dance for him (disproving B):

I'm not really getting toughest decision if she still went ahead and killed her father. Also the quote states it was not too difficult to elude the dude probing her mind not the part of her specifically dancing for him. Expand more on the dancing scene. Also it seems that Evelyn only knew of her father from memories or when she was younger. How did her father get captured. Also finish this quote...u cut it off:"It was Gordon, Lord Kane. Her father...." 

What was her response to when he said: "If you put a bolt between the man's eyes, you may dance for me tonight, and perhaps there will be other nights"

Bro wtf, you think her having to kill her dad wasn't the toughest decision of her life?? Yeah she did it, but she literally agonizes over it. Dude I get being sus but come on. 

It ends at her father, I just didn't include the period. Here's the sentence right after.

Story never expands on how the dad gets captured, but we do know that Earth is losing the war. Also to answer the memories thing, bro she's being ordered to kill her dad, she just flashes back to a good memory of him? But also, they fought together at the begining:
Her response to if you put a bolt is shooting her dad:
There is literally nothing more to the dancing scene - as for the quote saying it's not difficult to elude the probe, it's because she's dancing that it's easy to do both:
Also, she's been dancing for 30 nights so clearly its been easy dancing.
I rather be sus over a fiction sci-fi story then be wrong. I mean if she barely knew her father then B could be entirely right.

answers.reason for outcome: I won but judge's reasoning was so stupid, like I literally proved that she knew and was close with her father??
Provided good evidence. Answer was not clear cut but adding everything provided A seems the most logical.
